description: This covers installation of a battery in your home to store energy generated from your solar panels.
note_1: A representative battery storage costs about $16,000 depending on the size of your home, thus the average tax credit will be $4,800. You will realize your actual savings via a 30% tax credit.

description: Geothermal heating and cooling systems take advantage of stable temperatures underground by looping water through pipes, pulling heat from the ground in winter, and  from your home in the summer.
special_note: This incentive is not included in your personalized incentives.
note_1: A representative geothermal installation costs about $24,000 depending on the size of your home, thus the average tax credit will be $7,200. You will realize your actual savings via a 30% tax credit.

description: This tax credit covers upgrades to your electric panel to power more appliances.
special_note: You can combine this tax credit with an upfront discount for additional savings!
note_1: $600 is the max tax credit you can get per year. You will realize your actual savings via a 30% tax credit.
note_2: This tax credit is available in each tax year, effectively resetting and becoming available again for a household.

description: This incentive covers upgrades to your electric panel to power more appliances.
special_note: You can combine this upfront discount with a tax credit for additional savings!
note_1: The max amount covered is 50%, up to $14,000. You need to spend $28,000 across all qualified electrification projects to get the most savings.

description: This incentive covers upgrades to your electric panel to power more appliances.
special_note: You can combine this upfront discount with a tax credit for additional savings!
note_1: The maximum discount at purchase across qualified equipment projects is $14,000.

description: An electric stove is safer for the air quality in your home, and newer induction stoves are quicker and more precise than gas stoves.
note_1: The max amount covered is 50%, up to $14,000. You need to spend $28,000 across all qualified electrification projects to get the most savings.

description: An electric stove is safer for the air quality in your home, and newer induction stoves are quicker and more precise than gas stoves.
note_1: The maximum discount at purchase across qualified equipment projects is $14,000.

description: This incentive covers upgrades to your electric wiring to handle more appliances.
note_1: The maximum discount at purchase across qualified equipment projects is $14,000.

description: This incentive covers upgrades to your electric wiring to handle more appliances.
note_1: The max amount covered is 50%, up to $14,000. You need to spend $28,000 across all qualified electrification projects to get the most savings.

program: Alternative Fuel Vehicle Refueling Property Credit (30C)
description: An EV charger pulls electricity from your home and delivers it to an electric vehicle, just like any other appliance or device you charge by plugging into the wall.
note_1: The max amount covered is 30%, up to $1,000.

description: An electric vehicle is powered by plugging into electricity.
special_note: There is an existing EV credit that will be replaced with this one in 2023.
note_1: Applies to cars with a max MSRP of $55,000, and vans, SUVs, and pickup trucks with a max MSRP of $80,000.
note_2: Starting in 2024, these tax credits will convert into an upfront discount.

description: An electric vehicle is powered by plugging into electricity.
special_note: There is an existing EV credit that will be replaced with this one in 2023.
note_1: Applies to cars with a max MSRP of $55,000, and vans, SUVs, and pickup trucks with a max MSRP of $80,000.
note_2: Starting in 2024, these tax credits will convert into an upfront discount.

description: An electric vehicle is powered by plugging into electricity.

note_1: Applies to cars with a max MSRP of $55,000, and vans, SUVs, and pickup trucks with a max MSRP of $80,000.
note_2: Starting in 2024, these tax credits will convert into an upfront discount.

description: An electric vehicle is powered by plugging into electricity.
note_1: The tax credit applies to 30% of the cost of a used EV, up to $4,000, on a vehicle with a maximum MSRP of $25,000, weighing no more than 14,000 lbs.
note_2: Starting in 2024, these tax credits will be transferable to dealers, essentially converting into an upfront discount.

description: An electric vehicle is powered by plugging into electricity.

note_2: Starting in 2024, these tax credits will convert into an upfront discount.

description: An electric vehicle is powered by plugging into electricity.

description: A heat pump is powered by electricity and both heats and cools your home.
special_note: You can combine this tax credit with an upfront discount for additional savings!
note_1: $2,000 is the maximum tax credit you can get per year. You will receive your savings via a variable 30% tax credit on the cost of equipment and installation.
note_2: This tax credit is available in each tax year, effectively resetting and becoming available again for a household.

description: A heat pump water heater is powered by electricity. It works by pulling warm air from the environment and uses it to heat water in the tank. They can be 2-3 times more energy efficient than standard electric water heaters.
special_note: You can combine this tax credit with an upfront discount for additional savings!
note_1: $2,000 is the maximum tax credit you can get per year. You will receive your savings via a variable 30% tax credit on the cost of equipment and installation.
note_2: This tax credit is available in each tax year, effectively resetting and becoming available again for a household.

description: A heat pump water heater is powered by electricity. It works by pulling warm air from the environment and uses it to heat water in the tank. They can be 2-3 times more energy efficient than standard electric water heaters.
special_note: Great news! You can combine this upfront discount with a tax credit for additional savings.
note_1: The max amount covered is 50%, up to $14,000. Thus you need to spend $28,000 across all Qualified Electrification Projects to get the most savings.

description: A heat pump is powered by electricity and both heats and cools your home.

note_1: The max amount covered is 50%, up to $14,000. You need to spend $28,000 across all qualified electrification projects to get the most savings.

description: A heat pump clothes dryer uses 40-50% less energy than a standard electric dryer.

description: This covers installation of solar panels on your roof.
note_1: A representative rooftop solar project costs about $19,000 depending on the size of your home, thus the average tax credit will be $4,600. You will get your savings via a 30% tax credit. Project costs take into account price per watt in your state and assume a 6kW size project. In some cases, the 25D tax credit can also be applied to partial ownership of a community solar installation.

description: Weatherization includes insulation, air sealing and ventilation.
special_note: You can combine this upfront discount with a tax credit for additional savings!
note_1: The maximum discount at purchase across qualified equipment projects is $14,000.

description: Weatherization includes insulation, air sealing and ventilation.
special_note: You can combine this tax credit with an upfront discount for additional savings!
note_1: $1,200 is the max tax credit you can get per year. You will realize your actual savings via a 30% tax credit.
note_2: This tax credit is available in each tax year, effectively resetting and becoming available again for a household.

description: Weatherization includes insulation, air sealing and ventilation.
special_note: You can combine this upfront discount with a tax credit for additional savings!
note_1: The max amount covered is 50%, up to $14,000. You need to spend $28,000 across all qualified electrification projects to get the most savings.

description: This performance-based rebate is provided to homeowners who undertake energy efficiency home retrofits. A 35% or more energy reduction earns a $8,000 rebate. 15% or more earns a $4,000 rebate.
special_note: A whole-home rebate cannot be used in the same measure/project as an upfront discount.
note_1: This rebate will most likely require a home energy audit.

description: This performance-based rebate is provided to homeowners who undertake energy efficiency home retrofits. A 35% or more energy reduction earns $4,000 rebate. 15% or more earns a $2,000 rebate.
special_note: A whole-home rebate cannot be used in the same measure/project as an upfront discount.
note_1: This rebate will most likely require a home energy audit.
